intro: Phyteuma scheuchzeri subsp. scheuchzeri, commonly known as the Alpine phyteuma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowering period occurs in late summer, and it is known for its ornamental value in gardens and its ecological importance in alpine ecosystems. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific morphological traits and geographic distribution compared to other subspecies of Phyteuma.
